name: Bard(8), Red Dragon Disciple(10), Weapon Master(22), Dwarf
author: KidMiracleman

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
Would it possible to make a Bard(8), Red Dragon Disciple(10), Weapon Master(22), Dwarf??

David

posts.author: SmkNThDrkNght
posts.content: Yes it's possible in fact there's 4 human versions with the same level split you want on pulse caps search engine . The charisma being nerfed by the dwarf race sucks a little but rdd makes up for most stat deficits you may incur boosting cha at character creation.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content: I saw those. They had to use human for the feats to get the WM. If I use Batllerager that gives me exotic weapon proficiency free at creation

posts.author: SmkNThDrkNght
posts.content:
I don't know anything about the sub races or server side extras you get. I do know that exotic weapon pro isn't a prereq for rdd or wm (but gives a nicer selection of weapons for you) build should be pretty straight and easy peasy.

Take your wm prereqs along the way...

1-5 bard making sure to have 8 lore

6-15 rdd

16-40 wm with 3 bard skill dumps available along the way. I'd make sure to grab 7 wm first so maybe at 23 32 37.
Something like that or 27,32,37.

Since I don't have my pad of paper with me that's all I can give you right now. Maybe go back and see where those 4 builds took there skill dumps.
Also what's your overall goal for the build?

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
But will I have enough feats to be able to take the first level of WM at level 16 if I choose dwarf? The only way I can see doing it is if I choose a subrace that has a
free feat that I will need for WM like battlerager.

My over all goal is to have a build with a naked con of 30 and a naked str of at least 38. This does not have to be achieved by level 40 since there are 20 legendary levels

David

posts.author: SmkNThDrkNght
posts.content:
KidMiracleman wrote:
But will I have enough feats to be able to take the first level of WM at level 16 if I choose dwarf?


Yes the earliest you can take wm levels would be at 16 .
KidMiracleman wrote:
The only way I can see doing it is if I choose a subrace that has a
free feat that I will need for WM like battlerager.
You said it got exotic weapon pro.. that isn't a prereq for wm. They are Bab +5
Feats(6 & Note these feats require dexterity and intelligence scores of at least 13 ):Dodge, mobility, spring attack,expertise, weapon focus (melee weapon) & whirlwind attack.
Skills: intimidate 4
KidMiracleman wrote:
My over all goal is to have a build with a naked con of 30 and a naked str of at least 38. This does not have to be achieved by level 40 since there are 20 legendary levels

David

Someone else might have to help with that part.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
I understand exotic is not a prerequisite but if I want to focus in a dwarven war axe then I will need to take weapon proficiency exotic. I could focus in
something simple like a morning star or a dagger but then I could be a human and focus in those. The main reason I would choose a dwarf would be so I
can focus on the waraxe and in my opinion that is the best weapon on our server.

posts.author: SmkNThDrkNght
posts.content:
KidMiracleman wrote:
I understand exotic is not a prerequisite but if I want to focus in a dwarven war axe then I will need to take weapon proficiency exotic.
Correct and that battlerager gets it so sounds like a good match. Otherwise it'd knock wm down to lvl 19 to start.
KidMiracleman wrote:
I could focus in
something simple like a morning star or a dagger but then I could be a human and focus in those.
I actually like the idea of the morningstar since the dual weapon damage is fixed now. Would give the build flavor and the wm levels would certainly help with the critical threat range on it.
KidMiracleman wrote:
The main reason I would choose a dwarf would be so I
can focus on the waraxe and in my opinion that is the best weapon on our server.
Then go with the battlerager .
I don't know how legendary levels work but the 8/10/22 split doesn't equal 60.
Is it just an extra 20 levels? Feats every 3 (42,45,48,51,54,57,60) and stat raises every 4th (44,48,52,56,60)?

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content: yes. That is how legendary levels works

posts.author: SmkNThDrkNght
posts.content:
Goodness I miss my cbc...

Those are all decent lvl40 builds empyre nice job.

He should easily be able to get his con up to where he wants in the legendary levels.

I might actually suggest he sticks with the first one and finish leveling as a bard. I suppose it would mature slower than the other two, then again I don't know how the bonus feats play out legendary style or how it would affect the bard song etc so that suggestion can be taken with a grain of salt.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: Aye, stick with the first one and by the time you take all you legendary lvls you should be able to have STR 40/ CON 30 easily, OR STR 38/ CON 30 and IKD.

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content: How would you make this build for a Samurai???SamuraiRestriction race humanfavored class nonebenefits +2 str and wis +12 discipline and concentrationWhen using a katana the samurai gets 1 extra attack at level 2 and 2 at level 40feats weapon proficiency exotic overwhelming crit Katananegatives -2 ChaEcl 4

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
You can't have everything in one build. You always have to give one thing up to get another thing.

This build meets all your requirements except for high CON:
Spoiler [+]

Draconic Katana Master (Bard 11 / Red Dragon Disciple 10 / Weapon Master 19)
Human (Samurai), Non-Lawful
Playable 1 - 40

Made for Samurai "race" (Restriction race human, favored class none, benefits +2 str and wis, +12 discipline and concentration, When using a katana the samurai gets 1 extra attack at level 2 and 2 at level 40, feats weapon proficiency exotic, overwhelming crit Katana, negatives -2 Cha, Ecl 4)

posts.author: KidMiracleman
posts.content:
I thought so too. It was the very last one on the list. The only thing I do not like is no heavy armor or no toughness :(
Why 11 levels of bard??

David

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content:
KidMiracleman wrote:
I thought so too. It was the very last one on the list. The only thing I do not like is no heavy armor or no toughness :(
Why 11 levels of bard??

David
 
The build is feat-starved, getting WM without any Fighter feats. You get 34 AC with that medium armor and a shield, which is better than a Weapon Master without RDD with heavy armor and a shield. You get an impressive 760 health even without toughness.
The "extra" Bard levels are for skill dumps and a better song.

posts.author: Valerfor
posts.content: You can change WP: Exotic for Heavy Armour/Toughness if you like. With the Dragonic Armour boost to AC and Expertise you will be safe to keep a scimitar as a two-handed weapon and gain advantage of your big strength OR if you want to keep the shield you can wield a Short-Sword/Handaxe & Shield.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: Scimitars and shortswords are both Martial weapons, so you would need to take Weapon Proficiency: Martial, not saving a feat after all.
